metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5949 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
VideoLAN VLC media player 2.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted 3GP file, which triggers the freeing of arbitrary pointers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
libvlccore7 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-data - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-nox - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in trusty and earlier is different, and reproducer doesn't work.

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1').
